mapper.html:
Hello Admin,

The following event was reported, but the event could not be automatically found.

You may need to remove any trailing white space from the Event name (Column D in the Issue Reports spreadsheet), and if it finds the event ID etc, the 'Remove reported event' process can be manually triggered on Make.

EVENT INFO:

Timestamp: {{14.tripettoCreateDate}}

Title: {{14.`What is the problematic event?`}}

Details of issue: {{14.`Please detail the issue:`}}

Email of the reporter(may be blank): {{ifempty(14.`If you would like a response, please provide an email address (optional)`; "Email Not Provided")}}


All the very best,
Your friendly automated email bot

mapper.html:
Hello Admin,

A new issue has been reported.

Event: {{14.`What is the problematic event?`}}
What is the issue: {{14.`Please detail the issue:`}}
Email of reporting person (may be blank): {{ifempty(14.`If you would like a response, please provide an email address (optional)`; "Email Not Provided")}}

The event has been deleted automatically from the calendar, and the Tweet will also have been removed.

An admin will now need to check the event. Please log into the Google Account and find the 'Issue Reports' spreadsheet to complete the admin record. If the event turns out to be ok, you can manually re-add to the calendar and manually tweet again using the below information.

All the very best,
Your friendly automated email bot

Details: Timestamp: {{8.`0`}}

Event Title: {{8.`1`}}

Location: {{8.`2`}}

Start Date: {{8.`6`}}

End Date: {{8.`7`}}

Timezone: {{8.`5`}}

URL: {{8.`3`}}

Description: {{8.`4`}}
mapper.subject: New Issue Reported & Automatically Deleted
